item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and passed without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8436-8438; text as passed Senate: CR S8437-8438; text of measure as introduced: CR S8427-8428)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and passed without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S8436-8438; text as passed Senate: CR S8437-8438; text of measure as introduced: CR S8427-8428)

summary.text: States that the Senate has heard with profound sorrow and deep regret the announcement of the death of Nobel Laureate Jack St. Clair Kilby, inventor of the integrated circuit (known today as the microchip) and commends Mr. Kilby for his pioneering work in the fields of engineering and electronics, which laid the foundation for the technological advances of the 20th and 21st centuries.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses that the Senate has heard with profound sorrow and deep regret the announcement of the death of Nobel Laureate Jack St. Clair Kilby, inventor of the integrated circuit (known today as the microchip) and an innovative leader in the Information Age and commends Mr. Kilby for his pioneering work in the fields of engineering and electronics, which laid the foundation for the technological advances of the 20th and 21st centuries.

bill.title: A resolution honoring the life of Nobel Laureate Jack St. Clair Kilby, inventor of the integrated circuit and innovative leader in the Information Age.

item.title: A resolution honoring the life of Nobel Laureate Jack St. Clair Kilby, inventor of the integrated circuit and innovative leader in the Information Age.
A resolution honoring the life of Nobel Laureate Jack St. Clair Kilby, inventor of the integrated circuit and innovative leader in the Information Age.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
